title: I Am Tired of AI
dot:
digraph AI_Frustrations{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontsize=12, fontname="Helvetica"];main_idea[label="Frustration with AI
in Various Fields", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];testing_node[label="AI in Software Testing", fillcolor=lightgray];conference_node[label="AI in Conferences", fillcolor=lightgray];human_node[label="AI as a Human Being", fillcolor=lightgray];overall_concerns_node[label="Overall Concerns about AI", fillcolor=lightgray];testing_details[label="AI-powered tools often lack quality.
Faster results, not necessarily better results.
No replacement for human expertise.", shape=box];conference_details[label="Proposals often AI-generated.
Lack of originality & personal effort.
Risk of replacing human input.", shape=box];human_details[label="AI-generated content lacks emotional depth.
AI can't replicate human creativity.
Growing concern over AI-driven automation.", shape=box];concerns_details[label="AI's environmental impact.
Unrealistic expectations & ROI concerns.
Fear of AI replacing jobs.", shape=box];main_idea->testing_node;main_idea->conference_node;main_idea->human_node;main_idea->overall_concerns_node;testing_node->testing_details;conference_node->conference_details;human_node->human_details;overall_concerns_node->concerns_details;final_thought[label="AI can be beneficial in some areas
(e.g., disease detection), but not in everything.
Overuse and blind application is problematic.", shape=box, style=dashed];main_idea->final_thought;}

title: CA law means stores can't say you're buying a game if you're merely licensing it
